required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pharmacokinetic Study Comparing VI-0521 With Placebo in Obese Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study of VI-0521 in Obese Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to describe the pharmacokinetic profiles of VI-0521 in obese adolescents.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Clearance (CL/F) of Phentermine and Topiramate
primary_outcome.description: A Bayesian analysis was performed to derive posterior Bayes individual pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vc/F) of Phentermine and Topiramate
primary_outcome.description: A Bayesian analysis was performed to derive posterior Bayes individual PK parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Phentermine
primary_outcome.description: A Bayesian analysis was performed to derive posterior Bayes individual PK parameters. AUC from time 0 to 24 hours under steady-state.
A Bayesian analysis was performed to derive posterior Bayes individual PK parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Topiramate
primary_outcome.description: A Bayesian analysis was performed to derive posterior Bayes individual PK parameters. AUC from time 0 to 24 hours under steady-state.
A Bayesian analysis was performed to derive posterior Bayes individual PK parameters.

secondary_outcome.description: Mean percent weight change from baseline to Day 56
Mean change in waist circumference from baseline to Day 56
Mean change in blood pressure from baseline to Day 56

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in OGTT of Fasting and 2-hour Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Mean changes in glycemic parameters (OGTT of fasting and 2-hour glucose) from baseline to Day 56
Mean percent changes in lipid parameters, including total cholesterol, LDL-C, HDL-C and triglycerides (TG) from baseline to Day 56

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Hunger Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in visual analog scale (VAS) hunger scores from baseline to Day 56. VAS hunger score is measured using a 10.0 cm horizontal line. The left end of this line is defined by word descriptors "not at all hungry" and corresponds to a VAS hunger score of 0.0. The right end of this line is defined by word descriptors "extremely hungry all the time" and corresponds to a VAS hunger score of 10.0. Subjects were asked "Please mark with a perpendicular line on the scale how hungry you were overall during the past week:" to best describes their overall level of hunger during the past week. Research staff measure the distance between the "0.0 = not at all hungry" anchor and the mark made by the subject (length to the nearest tenth of a centimeter) to score the measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Satiety Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in visual analog scale (VAS) satiety scores from baseline to Day 56. VAS satiety score is measured using a 10.0 cm horizontal line. The left end of this line is defined by word descriptors "very satisfied" and corresponds to a VAS satiety score of 0.0. The right end of this line is defined by word descriptors "not all at satisfied" and corresponds to a VAS satiety score of 10.0. Subjects were asked "Please mark with a perpendicular line on the scale how satisfied you were after eating during the past week:" to evaluate how satisfied subjects are after eating during the past week. Research staff measure the distance between the "0.0 = very satisfied" anchor and the mark made by the subject (length to the nearest tenth of a centimeter) to score the measure.
Mean changes in glycemic parameters (HOMA-IR) from baseline to Day 56

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Whole Body Insulin Sensitivity Index (WBISI) (Matsuda)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean changes in glycemic parameters [Whole Body Insulin Sensitivity Index (WBISI) (Matsuda)] from baseline to Day 56. The Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) were performed at Baseline and Day 56 using 75 g oral glucose load; blood samples were obtained at baseline and at 2 hours post glucose load for evaluation of both glucose and insulin levels. Insulin Sensitivity was measured by obtaining glucose and insulin levels in a fasting state and at 2 hours after administration of oral glucose load. Matsuda index = 10,000/SQRT [glucose concentration (mg/dL) (fasting)*insulin concentration (uIU/mL) (fasting)*glucose concentration (mg/dL) (2 hours after glucose load)*insulin concentration (uIU/mL) (2 hours after glucose load)], with higher numbers indicating better insulin sensitivity.

arm_group.description: Days 1-14: VI-0521 (Phentermine/Topiramate 3.75 mg/23 mg) Days 15-56: VI-0521 (Phentermine/Topiramate 7.5 mg/46 mg)

outcome.title: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Hunger Scores
outcome.description: Mean change in visual analog scale (VAS) hunger scores from baseline to Day 56. VAS hunger score is measured using a 10.0 cm horizontal line. The left end of this line is defined by word descriptors "not at all hungry” and corresponds to a VAS hunger score of 0.0. The right end of this line is defined by word descriptors "extremely hungry all the time” and corresponds to a VAS hunger score of 10.0. Subjects were asked "Please mark with a perpendicular line on the scale how hungry you were overall during the past week:" to best describes their overall level of hunger during the past week. Research staff measure the distance between the "0.0 = not at all hungry" anchor and the mark made by the subject (length to the nearest tenth of a centimeter) to score the measure.
outcome.population: The number of subjects with values at both time points (Baseline and Day 56)

measure.title: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Hunger Scores
measure.description: Mean change in visual analog scale (VAS) hunger scores from baseline to Day 56. VAS hunger score is measured using a 10.0 cm horizontal line. The left end of this line is defined by word descriptors "not at all hungry” and corresponds to a VAS hunger score of 0.0. The right end of this line is defined by word descriptors "extremely hungry all the time” and corresponds to a VAS hunger score of 10.0. Subjects were asked "Please mark with a perpendicular line on the scale how hungry you were overall during the past week:" to best describes their overall level of hunger during the past week. Research staff measure the distance between the "0.0 = not at all hungry" anchor and the mark made by the subject (length to the nearest tenth of a centimeter) to score the measure.

outcome.title: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Satiety Scores
outcome.description: Mean change in visual analog scale (VAS) satiety scores from baseline to Day 56. VAS satiety score is measured using a 10.0 cm horizontal line. The left end of this line is defined by word descriptors "very satisfied” and corresponds to a VAS satiety score of 0.0. The right end of this line is defined by word descriptors "not all at satisfied” and corresponds to a VAS satiety score of 10.0. Subjects were asked "Please mark with a perpendicular line on the scale how satisfied you were after eating during the past week:" to evaluate how satisfied subjects are after eating during the past week. Research staff measure the distance between the "0.0 = very satisfied" anchor and the mark made by the subject (length to the nearest tenth of a centimeter) to score the measure.
outcome.population: The number of subjects with values at both time points (Baseline and Day 56)

outcome.title: Change in Whole Body Insulin Sensitivity Index (WBISI) (Matsuda)
outcome.description: Mean changes in glycemic parameters [Whole Body Insulin Sensitivity Index (WBISI) (Matsuda)] from baseline to Day 56. The Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) were performed at Baseline and Day 56 using 75 g oral glucose load; blood samples were obtained at baseline and at 2 hours post glucose load for evaluation of both glucose and insulin levels. Insulin Sensitivity was measured by obtaining glucose and insulin levels in a fasting state and at 2 hours after administration of oral glucose load. Matsuda index = 10,000/SQRT [glucose concentration (mg/dL) (fasting)*insulin concentration (uIU/mL) (fasting)*glucose concentration (mg/dL) (2 hours after glucose load)*insulin concentration (uIU/mL) (2 hours after glucose load)], with higher numbers indicating better insulin sensitivity.
outcome.population: The number of subjects with values at both time points (Baseline and Day 56)

measure.title: Change in Whole Body Insulin Sensitivity Index (WBISI) (Matsuda)
measure.description: Mean changes in glycemic parameters [Whole Body Insulin Sensitivity Index (WBISI) (Matsuda)] from baseline to Day 56. The Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) were performed at Baseline and Day 56 using 75 g oral glucose load; blood samples were obtained at baseline and at 2 hours post glucose load for evaluation of both glucose and insulin levels. Insulin Sensitivity was measured by obtaining glucose and insulin levels in a fasting state and at 2 hours after administration of oral glucose load. Matsuda index = 10,000/SQRT [glucose concentration (mg/dL) (fasting)*insulin concentration (uIU/mL) (fasting)*glucose concentration (mg/dL) (2 hours after glucose load)*insulin concentration (uIU/mL) (2 hours after glucose load)], with higher numbers indicating better insulin sensitivity.
measure.population: The number of subjects with values at both time points (Baseline and Day 56)

group.description: VI-0521 Top Dose: phentermine 15 mg and topiramate 92 mg, po once daily

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI may publish the result of the study 12 months or longer after termination of the study. The PI will provide the sponsor a copy of any proposed publication at least 30 days prior to submission for publication
